sets.name: Kicking Set 1
sets.intro: This set emphasizes directional kicking—executed at the four cardinal points—to build balance, control, and recovery through transitions between neutral, twist, and spinning stances.

steps.text: Right foot steps back into a left neutral bow.
Step through with a right ball kick, landing in a right neutral bow.
Left foot crosses over right into a twist stance; execute a right side kick, landing in a right neutral bow.
Left foot shuffle, right roundhouse kick, landing in a right neutral bow.
Left spinning rear kick, landing in a left neutral bow.
Drop the right foot back to 9 o'clock into a left neutral bow facing 3 o'clock.
Right step-through side kick, landing in a right neutral bow.
Left foot shuffle, right ball kick, landing in a right neutral bow.
Left foot shuffle, right roundhouse kick, landing in a right neutral bow.
Left foot shuffle, right rear kick, landing in a right neutral bow.
Drop the left foot to 12 o'clock into a right neutral bow facing 6 o'clock.
Left spinning rear kick, landing in a left neutral bow.
Shuffle left roundhouse kick, landing in a left neutral bow.
Shuffle left front kick, landing in a left neutral bow.
Shuffle left side kick, landing in a left neutral bow.
Drop the right foot back to 3 o'clock into a left neutral bow facing 9 o'clock.
Right step-through ball kick, landing in a right neutral bow.
Left step-through roundhouse kick, landing in a left neutral bow.
Right spinning rear kick, landing in a right neutral bow.
Left step-through side kick, landing in a horse stance facing 12 o'clock.

footerNotes: Focus on balance and chamber control between kicks.
Each set aligns with a cardinal direction: 12, 3, 6, and 9 o’clock.
Maintain structure and recover to a stable stance after each kick.
